speaker: Dad
text: Look at this, Mary! It's an old computer from work.

speaker: Mary
text: Why did you bring it home, dad?

speaker: Dad
text: I thought this might be a good opportunity to show you how computers work. Plus, it's broken, so it's a chance for us to fix something together.

speaker: Dad
text: Sure, Mary, but let's do it together later when I have time. Okay?

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary waits until her father leaves for work, then sneaks into his workshop. She pulls out the old computer and starts poking around inside, trying to remember what her father showed her.*

speaker: Mary
text: *Suddenly, there's a loud spark and a flash of light. Mary jumps back, dropping the screwdriver.* Oh no! *She hurriedly disconnects the computer and hides it away.*

speaker: Mary
text: Dad, I tried fixing the computer...

speaker: Mary
text: I... I was impatient, and I tried fixing it while it was still plugged in. There was a spark...

speaker: Dad
text: Oh, Mary... I'm just glad you're not hurt. But you must understand, some things require patience. And safety is paramount. I promise to guide you, Mary, but you have to be patient and listen to me. Can you do that?

speaker: Mary
text: Yes, Dad, I understand. I'm sorry...
